Description: This is a tour to and from Hoffellsjokull which is a nice attraction if you stay in Hofn, east region. There is also a small lake which makes the view simply gorgeous.
Centre of culture and history with monastic ruins, historical exhibitions, art gallery, gift shop and a local food restaurant.

In the valley Jökuldalur (Glacier Valley) in East Iceland there is a marvellous natural site that almost nobody knew about until recently. For a long time it was hidden under water or until the hydroelectric plant Kárahnjúkavirkjun was built and the waterflow in the glacier river Jökulsá á Dal, a.k.a. Jökla, was extremely reduced.

This day trip to the Golden Circle from Reykjavik is a stress-free way to see some of Iceland’s most beautiful attractions. Don’t worry about mapping out an itinerary: Let your guide and driver take you to Kerid crater, the Blue Lagoon, Gullfoss waterfall, and more. Plus, your guide explains local history and geology that you wouldn’t learn traveling on your own.
Small Description: A day trip around the golden circle

Description: Enjoy a day exploring the wonders of Snæfellsnes Peninsula. Black sands, golden sands, lava formations, view of the glacier Snæfellsjökull.

Explore the capital city, Reykjavik, at your leisure on a guided walking tour of the city. Begin at Hallgrimskirkja, the largest church in Iceland, then wind through the heart of the city with stops at several historic and modern landmarks.
Small Description: See Rekyjavík´s main sights in a few hours

Tour Name: Guided Full-Day Tour of Iceland's South Coast
Description: This tour from Reykjavik covers the highlights of Iceland’s south coast in a single day. Travel by bus to the waterfalls of Skogafoss and Seljalandsfoss, the black-sand beach of Reynisfjarna, and the Solheimajokull Glacier, where you’ll walk right up to touch the ice. Learn about the area’s unique geology and culture from your guide along the way, and enjoy convenient hotel pickup and drop-off for a hassle-free day.
Small Description: a day tour of the South Coast

Description: Gain an intimate glimpse of Iceland’s glacial landscape on this hiking tour of Sólheimajökull, suited to all ages and ability levels. Benefit from the personalized attention of your small-group guide as you traverse the icy rockface at a time that suits you and avoid hidden costs with equipment rental included in the price.

Tour Name: Ice Cave Tour in the National Park of Vatnajökull
Description: This is the perfect pick for adventurous travelers. Experience the buzz of exploring a naturally formed ice cave in Vatnajökull National Park. No need to worry if it’s your first time ice caving—all required safety equipment is provided, and a guide accompanies you at all times. See incredible views of one of Europe’s largest glaciers—Vatnajökull glacier, and access lots of spectacular photo opportunities.

Maximize your chances of seeing humpback whales on this Eyjafjord whale watching cruise from Akureyri. Iceland’s longest fjord is known for attracting these massive mammals for summer feeding. Board a high-speed, specially adapted ship capable of covering all the likely viewing areas, and watch for whales from the viewing platforms and decks.

Tour Name: Lake Myvatn Day Tour and Godafoss Waterfall
Description: Tick off northern Iceland’s natural attractions with ease on this full-day tour to Godafoss and Lake Myvatn from Akureyri. Let your driver handle navigation as you soak up sweeping views of the geothermal landscape and enjoy additional stops at snap-worthy spots such as the Dimmuborgir lava fields and Myvatn hot springs (bathing own expense), learning more about the region’s natural and cultural heritage from your small-group guide.
